reviews.review_msg: Changed my life.

Dr. harden is a wonderful teacher! his exams were very refreshing compared to most other MBB courses in the way that its not just straight memorization, you actually have to think. The final is doable, i spent maybe 3 days studying for it and did ok. He does speak very quietly and can mumble so sit near the front if you want to catch everything!

Go to class!! There is a lot of material and frankly, not much of it is very important.  Study hard for the midterms because the final is killer.  He does speak quietly and tends to mumble sometimes so sit near the front if you can.

Always sit at the front with NO ONE in your vicinity otherwise you will get lost- Talks incredibly quietly. But he's VERY clear and loved how he stated one point in 10 different ways and used analogies often. 1st midterm was hard since it was all about experimental techniques. 2nd was easy. Final was okay, lots of comparisons. Overall, I liked him.

He tends to mumble in his lectures and doesnt use a mic. But lectures are very important. The final was quite hard, a lot of emphasis on comparison between pro and eukaryotes, and experimental techniques. He likes to put in random specific proteins as well, so watch out for those. He barely uses actual material from the notes.

He lectures very quietly so you might want to sit at the front rows. His midterms were somewhat fair, however the final which was meant to be cumulative but weighted largely on the last section of the course was TOUGH and did not weigh more on the new materials. One hard course with one hard prof.

He's a nice guy.helpful in office hours.This course is really tough though. there is a lot of material to memorize. 1st midterm was somewhat hard but still fair. 2nd midterm was pretty fair.the final was HARD! it was Brutal!!! There were way too many Qs on 1st and 2nd section of the course! midterms by no means reflect what you can expect on final.
The presentation was a waste of time. There was no time  allocated to problem set questions and preparation for the final. Fair midterms but final was brutal

Midterms were meant to give you an idea what the final will be, but it wasn't. Final was cumulative and ridiculously questioned eg.  provide not just 2 but 4 to 5 examples of a certain concept for pretty much a whole chunk of the final. During the final, a third of the students had to chill out by heading to the washroom.

the course material is hard so you need to work hard yourself to do well. but dr.harden explains the material very well and jokes once in a while to try to keep his lecture fresh. exams are fair, though sometimes there are not enough time. highly recommend this prof.

Basically taught myself the whole course out of the textbook. His exams are absolutely brutal and he asks the most irrelevant questions about topics discussed for 5 minutes on 1 slide. He's so vague and not great at explaining, even when prompted.
hardest final ive ever done in my entire life. two girls cried. I recommend you not take it with him.
hard tests, not enough materials to help you

I retook this course so i had Dr. Beh's notes for the same slides he used. The courses is mostly self study so to get close to avg you need to really understand the material. Finals were complicated indirect questions from multiple mini topics. sample tutorial questions mostly irrelevant except for PCR, gel reading, and restriction mapping.

I retook this course so i know he used Dr. Beh's notes who gave me notes for the same slides he used. Mostly self study.to get close to avg you need to really understand the material. Final were complicated indirect questions from multiple mini topics.sample tutorial questions mostly irrelevant except for PCR, gel reading, and restriction mapping.
brutal exams,specially final! still shocked!
He was overall an okay prof, he seemed to enjoy the subject matter (which was tricky!)...exams were tough, especially the final!

Christopher's lectures were not only long, but his voice droned on for 3 hours (an hour longer than our designated lecture time). His exams were very specific on certain things discussed in lecture yet not covered in lecture slides. Be ready to take lots of notes and read everything he assigns.
Dr. Beh is extremely condescending to his students.

Lectures were very interesting, and he generally seemed like a cool guy. Midterms were fair, he recyled a few questions from problem sets from previous weeks. Make sure you know your restriction maps and primer design questions for MT 1 and Final! Only thing that really bothered me is that answers were not posted for PS's before quizzes/midterms.
Very hard course. Prof is not at all helpful. Gets mad at students for not doing well
Hardcore

He talks for the whole 50 minutes, nonstop. It's difficult to follow along what is going on in class. Would be better if provided answers for practice exam. Exams were fair, but very tight for time. Go to his office hours, he explains things very well and clearly and he's a nice guy.
good

mbb331 is a hard course. when u go to his office hrs and ask him questions he is very helpful. I do agree that it is hard to follow what is going on in class. The midterm was hard but i did well cuz i also read the text, which not many ppl did that is y the average was so low.

He is an excellent prof. His notes were the most detailed I have ever seen. But his exams were so hard. Not at all on par with what we were taught in class. I ended up not doing so well in this course because the exams were so damn hard but I learned a lot from him. Only take this course with him if you don't care about your GPA.

Dr.Beh is very nice and tries to explain things the best he can. He also showed high interest in the course that he teaches. The class itself covers a lot of material, but he is fair in giving the exam questions and he also provides practice midterms.

Really knows his stuff, too bad he isn't able to clearly present it to you for you to grasp. His tests were not completely reflective of what he taught. If you are going to gie a question on a test, make sure you go over in detail how to do it.
Dr. Beh is the best! He really cares and is willing to explain something more than once.  He speaks very well during lecture and presents the material in an understandable way.  BEST PROF!!!

He was extremely rude when students approached him.  He actually yelled at the class and was implying that we were stupid because the average was so low on one of his exams.  Obviously if we have made it to 3rd year we aren't that stupid so what does that say about your exams and teaching.  Try taking this class with any other professor but him!!

Great teacher and very knowledgeable and interested in topics.  Good notes and text book relates well. Exams not difficult, but fair; straight from notes. However, actual course is quite difficult in terms of tons of information.  Keep up with notes and readings and try to review regularly otherwise you'll get swept away.

So far, he's been able to present his lectures with clarity and without a doubt he knows his stuff. This course is pretty much emphasized on DNA...but there are a lot of content covered in this course!!! His exams are indeed tough, but fair. This is an arduous course..so..if you study hard, you should be able to get at least a B-.
Good speaker, well prepared. Lectures worth attending. Exams fair. Understand notes and you will do well.Very approachable for help.

Very nice man!  Tries his best to help you and to be fair.  Exams are a bit tough, especially since the material is in abundance and also a bit complex.  Way too many gene names to remember.  331 is MBB 222 kicked up a notch...more DNA, more gene names, more freakin' examples...know your primers!
an inspiring teacher who clearly explains everything.  his lectures are definately worth going to, I learn so much every time i go.  His tests are challenging but fair.
He's good, dry, but good.

He can easily flip through 20 Powerpoint slides in one lecture, and we are supposed to memorize all that. His slides do not have a lot of text explanations on them, and sometimes are not very clear. Lectures are quite boring as well.
Talk way too fast in lecture..... hard to follow his talk.... have to study myself.
I like Dr. Beh...he's very clear and organized with his presentations, and he seems to actually care how students do in his class!! :)  He hasn't yet become bitter like some of the older profs.

OH GOD!!! seriously i dont understand why people like him teach, we're in university not highschool school stop lecturing us on coming to class bc those who actually attend have to hear about it even though we're sitting in class! exams HARD!! Run away now!!

my friends warned me to not take mbb331 with him, but I found him totally approachable and helpful. I agree that his exams are tricky, but it allows you to really apply and test your knowledge. Pretty clear during lectures. Also, he doesn't expect you to memorize every little detail - pay attention to the big concepts and what he emphasizes

Run for the hills! Honda's an okay lecturer, his notes can be made clearer, but the thing to beware is his exams. Honestly, besides his exams being long, you'll have to apply your knowledge like never before! Even if you understand the material and have it memorized down pat, his questions are thrown from way out in left field. Low survival odds!

His lecture notes are a little hard to understand, but attending lectures and listening to his explanations are really helpful.  Not a lot of practice questions given (the ones given do not really reflect the questions asked on exams). He gives quite a bit of choice on midterms and final. He focuses mostly on knowledge questions.

people say exams are hard...it's true but who cares when he scales them so a 50% is an A...very easy to get a good mark...what you need to know:1)attend class and take notes.2)make sure you understand the sample questions he goes over in class3)go to his office and ask him questions-make sure you are prepared before going. He is very funny,friendly

seriously, his jokes are not funny. He tries to be nice and all that but it rarely works. Try to pay good attention to what he says because his notes are not easy to understand. The book is not necessary; however, attendance is a must.

Honda's a nice guy, very approachable, friendly, and a funny lecturer. On the down-side, however, he provides very few problem sets which makes it hard to practice and his notes don't provide enough detail and are quite unclear at times.

Complete duff. Seems like he wants to prove he knows more than the students rather than actually teach. Completely unhelpful, tells you to go read the notes when you ask him something. Exam marking is arbitrary, gives points for things that wasn't mentioned in lecture or textbook at all.

An interesting prof. you don't need the textbook - lecture notes should be enough (though u need to listen carefully and take good notes during class). tests are very long and hard, but he scales the grades, so it works out ok. pretty funny guy.

I can honestly say that he is one of the worst prof i've ever had. it's not that I didn't understand anything he said, and  I didn't study any less in this class compared to my other classes, but for some reason, he managed to fail more than 50% of the class for the midterm, and same for the final. do NOT take 331 with him, I warn you!
Bad notes, boring lectures... hard exams... you have to be either suicidal or A+ student to take a class with him.  Good day
